author: David Hodari
title: Aluminum’s Jump Accelerates as LME Echoes U.S. Sanctions
text:
London-traded aluminum futures’ rise accelerated late on Tuesday, after the London Metal Exchange echoed U.S. sanctions on Russian individuals, announcing a trading suspension on metal from the world’s second-largest aluminum producer, United Co. Rusal.
The industrial metal’s futures climbed 4.5% to $2,229 a metric ton in late trading in London, with the metal’s early week rally intensifying after the news broke.
